snippet.textDisplay:
I've only played Super, Fusion, and Zero Mission. Of those three i have to say that Fusion was the best by far. Super was fun but i was honestly disappointed by it. Almost no storyline and the controls are not as fluid as the GBA duo. Running from SA-X was awesome and heart-pounding, and i love how reaching locks and containing different problems in the lab leads you from sector to sector and back again to previous but altered ones. In Super it was more arbitrary, like "what abilities do you have? Just go wherever you can reach until you hit another roadblock." which doesn't give a very satisfying sense of purpose to me. It feels more like i'm just running a long puzzle. Fusion really took that same mechanic and fleshed it into a believable world. There's a reason for each place you go, beyond just "oh now i have this ability so i can open this new area." 
Just one man's opinion. Fusion was awesome! I don't actually remember ZeroMission as well as i'd like. I want to replay.

snippet.textDisplay:
Thank you for bringing up Other M because I have to get something off my chest. Other M is one of my favorite Metroid games to date, and all the reasons people hate it are really, really stupid. Allow me to elaborate.

For one, I absolutely LOVE how it takes place in between Super Metroid and Metroid Fusion (my favorite 2D Metroid games). Also the gameplay is absolutely fantastic. I love how it incorporates both 2D-ish Metroid gameplay (which we hadn't seen since Zero Mission in 2004) along with first person Prime-esque elements. It's incredible how they were able to mesh two completely different play-styles into one game so effortlessly. The controls are responsive and fluid; IMO they could not be more perfect.

Secondly, the story. I love love love love LOVE the story in this game! It gives some really neat backstory to Metroid Fusion, and is really engaging and interesting. (Great plot twists too).

Sure, the voice acting is sub-par, and PTSD Samus is a little less bad ass than usual, but overall, this is a really great and welcome addition to the Metroid franchise.
snippet.textOriginal:

For one, I absolutely LOVE how it takes place in between Super Metroid and Metroid Fusion (my favorite 2D Metroid games). Also the gameplay is absolutely fantastic. I love how it incorporates both 2D-ish Metroid gameplay (which we hadn't seen since Zero Mission in 2004) along with first person Prime-esque elements. It's incredible how they were able to mesh two completely different play-styles into one game so effortlessly. The controls are responsive and fluid; IMO they could not be more perfect.

Secondly, the story. I love love love love LOVE the story in this game! It gives some really neat backstory to Metroid Fusion, and is really engaging and interesting. (Great plot twists too).

Sure, the voice acting is sub-par, and PTSD Samus is a little less bad ass than usual, but overall, this is a really great and welcome addition to the Metroid franchise.

Personally, I believe there were always subtle warnings in prior Metroid games for a lot of the stuff people had issues with regarding Samus's portayal in MOM.

That's the problem though - in Other M, Samus went from having perhaps the most subtle characterization someone could ever have to having everything overblown, which rendered her nigh-on unrecognizable to me.

snippet.textDisplay: As for Samus character though, I think that was the thing. snippet.textOriginal:
1. Metroid Prime, it totally changed how I looked at games, first person shooters and virtual environments. One of the greatest games ever made.

2. The Super Metroid theme. Mysterious and gripping, it seems to best captivate some of the greatest things in Metroid.

3. The Metroid series, although it's much closer to me than I realized, it's a tough decision.

snippet.textDisplay:
1. Either Metroid 2, which was my first Metroid game and still gives me nightmares, or the 1st Prime, which I tohught had the most interesting exploration.

2. Metroid Prime menu screen. There's just something about it that's so sci-fi and exciting.

3. I think I prefer Metroidvania games because I have gotten more fun out of them, but that's not to say that the Metroid games are not awesome. They are so awesome.

4. Varia Suit all the way.

snippet.textDisplay:
1. Super metroid hands down. It was the first game I played that had the ominous atmosphere and it stuck with me. Made me believe that the only way you can make a game scary or make it a thriller is all in the atmosphere.

2. Brinstar Red Soil - This is the song that made the game for me. Just so ominous and chilling.

3. This is a very hard choice for me. Since they are all so good in their own right, But I am going to have to go with Metroid.

4. Fusion Suit.

snippet.textDisplay:
1. Metroid Prime.  Super Metroid was just as good, but I enjoyed Prime a bit more.

2. Hmm... so many good themes!  My fave is probably Magmoor Caverns from Metroid Prime.  I'm surprised you went with Kraid's Lair from the original, since Metroid Prime was one of the first titles to appear on this list.

3. I prefer Castlevania games.  They have actual dialogue, and they are difficult at times, which the later Metroid games really aren't.

4. I always liked the Phazon Suit from Metroid Prime.
